newsitem.title: DUBAI: Ford says Middle East H1 sales up 25 pct.
newsitem.headline: Ford says Middle East H1 sales up 25 pct.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said on Wednesday its vehicle sales in the Middle East grew to record levels in the first half of 1997.
"Sales were up 25 percent over the same period in 1996," Ford Middle East Marketing Manager Kurt Peterson said in a statement. He gave no figure for units sold.
Ford Crown Victoria and Mercury Grand Marquis cars led the way, with their sales up 60 percent over first half 1996. No unit total was given.
In 1996 Ford had its best year in the Middle East since its re-entry into the region a decade ago, the statement said. It said total shipments reached 14,824 units -- 36 percent up on 1995.
